summary: This document is a response from AT&T's Global Legal Demand Center to an FBI request for subscriber information, accompanied by a certificate of authenticity signed by an AT&T Legal Compliance Analyst. It indicates AT&T was unable to identify a unique subscriber based on the provided date range.

persons.name: Peter Simmer
persons.context: He attests to the authenticity of the AT&T records provided in response to an FBI legal demand, certifying them under penalty of perjury.

events.title: FBI Legal Demand to AT&T
events.description: The FBI's Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force sent a legal demand to AT&T for subscriber information.

events.title: AT&T Response and Certification
events.description: AT&T's Legal Compliance Analyst, Peter Simmer, signed a certificate of authenticity for the records provided in response to the FBI demand, stating they were unable to identify a unique subscriber.

locations: AT&T 11760 US Hwy 1, Suite 300, North Palm Beach, FL 33408
keyFacts: The FBI's Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force (File Code 2750182) made a legal demand to AT&T for subscriber information on June 6, 2019.
AT&T's response, dated June 21, 2019, states that after a thorough search, they were unable to identify a unique subscriber based on the provided date range.
Peter Simmer, an AT&T Legal Compliance Analyst, certified the authenticity of the provided records under penalty of perjury pursuant to Federal Rules of Evidence 902(11) and 902(13).
The document is marked as confidential and intended only for the intended recipient, the FBI task force.
The response originated from AT&T's Global Legal Demand Center at their North Palm Beach, Florida address.
